title: LoL on macbook pro
body:
Hey guys. 

I know there are many forums on whether lol runs on MacBook or not. But they seem to be old and outdated so I want to ask this question again.

First of all, I've never owned a MacBook before but I really want to because they look so freaking awesome. Currently I have Samsung tablet pc which runs lol just fine with occasional lag (not sure if it's the laptop or the internet problem). I play adc a lot so even the tiniest lag is enough to drive me crazy. To make things worse, the screen part of the pc sometimes disconnects from the keyboard port, leaving me with the mouse control only..... so I really think it's time to upgrade to new laptop.

I've been thinking of getting MacBook this time, and I know what you guys are thinking: 'if you want performance, go for pc... blah blah'
I just want to know if MacBook is good enough to play lol without lag or heating up too much.
(besides, have you guys seen the new gold MacBook pro?? it looks amazing).

If I do go for MacBook, I would probably go for MacBook Air or the cheapest and smallest (I think 13 inch?) of MacBook pro with retina and SSD. Anything above that is beyond my budget.

So, how are those two when it comes to LOL?

replies.body:
> MacBook

\*facepalm\* 

> First of all, I've never owned a MacBook before but I really want to because they look so freaking awesome.

\*double facepalm\*

> If I do go for MacBook, I would probably go for MacBook Air or the cheapest and smallest (I think 13 inch?) of MacBook pro with retina and SSD. Anything above that is beyond my budget.

Alternatively you could get a custom build PC that can run a vast variety of games, a laptop that can run a good variety of games and a car, but don't let that change your mind if macs look, and I quote, "so freaking awesome"

I think you misunderstood my point. You sound just like my friend when I told him I wanted to get a MacBook.

First of all, gaming is not the main reason I want to get a new laptop. I need one for my uni stuff and if I can run lol on it, that would be nice.
And I only play lol. Don't really play any other games that require higher spec so it's pointless for me to get a high quality pc that I'm not going to be fully satisfied with when it comes to non-gaming related work.

anyway, thanks for your input.

> I think you misunderstood my point.

You're wanting a new computer and you're on a budget. The fact you want to use it for more work related tasks than gaming doesn't change the fact that proper PCs are more cost efficient than macs. If you had money to burn fair enough but that's not the case is it?

I'm using a mac book pro to play league right now and i have to say its okay but it doesn't have its downs, like when you are on like 100 health in a 1v1 it will lag you so you cant do anything and then you die.. its a down side but its only occasional.. and it does have its problems with lag but overall its runs quite alright but i would recommend you to buy a pc rather then a macbook, yes they look cool but they are more for business people, gaming you should use a pc, trust me on this buy a pc with the money.. if you want a better league experience.
What happens, is before you die once you get 5 fps whenever you see the enemy, you have to die to unlock 60fps
nah its more like if you don't die in the next 1-3 seconds then it frees you from your fps curse... its just like once your under like 200health (depending on champion) you freeze.
This happens, but for me its seems to not happen as much once i die (i don't know why)
yeah its not the most pleasurable thing in the world
What fps do you get during a game, usually mine is a steady 60, but has its big dips.
steady 60 fps but has dips as wells :c

Thank you for your reply. I just wanted to know if MacBook is ok for league.
I agree that pc will provide better gaming experience but since I'm not really competitive (I'm bronze XD), based on people's comment, I think MacBook pro will do just fine for me.

Been running LOL on my mac since S3 and frame rates will be your biggest issue. Just don't play at the maximum settings and you will be fine. Apart from that, If you can, go for the Macbook pro range as that gives you more processing power. As for heat, get a cooling pad (you should have one if you are gaming on a laptop anyways).

I got a 2012 macbook pro i play lol on the windows boot and it runs at 200 fps .om mac OS it just dont . if u only play lol then a macbook pro with windows on it it will be fine but if you consider to play other games as well then dont buy a mac . i got the mac becouse it better in other stuff like rendering and battery life for games dont even mention it. I am also able to stream lol at full hd while i play with no lag.
i have a friend ho plays it on a macbook pro 2014 and it runs perfect... butt i guess it is a full speced one

I have a question because everyone is saying they use a boot camp thing and someone left the link in a comment and when i clicked it,it said the website was shut down currently due since there's a mac download and i can't find it since i want to play league on my macbook pro.

I know im a year late, but I run the early 2015 Macbook Pro 13 inch and I get a decent 100-150 frames with 25 ms on medium and medium high... thing is my fans are very loud, so I put on headsets to counter that. Anything over medium high to me is considered not playable to do frequent fps drops. I do alright with medium high, but if i find my fans are getting really loud or if 150 fps is not needed I play medium. I usually play Ahri and kat mid so 1v1 in lane is fine, but some team fights cause my mac to lag, but thats usually normal
i have the macbook pro 13 inch early 2015 and i get 120-140 fps at high. I don't know why people are getting 60

Yeah, you may get bugsplatted a bit if you don't get a decent Mac with pretty good specs.
I'm using the Macbook Pro 13 inch 2013 model, and it runs LoL alright, but I think it's just my internet when it comes to the INSANE lag for sometimes a week even (just a heads-up)....

Thanks heaps for your comments.

I was just worried that after spending like $2000 on MacBook, I won't be able to play lol on it.
Seems like some of you are playing lol on MacBook without too much problems and that's all I needed to know. Cheers.

yeah, mine's like a pc/tablet. One of those laptops that you can separate the screen part away from the keyboard. So I guess all the hardware is built into the screen. Bought it for $2000 NZD on Christmas sale. I thought this was a really cool feature but turns out I never really use it as tablet lol. Seems like I wasted my money.

Im currently using a MacBook Air and it runs fine.  its like a normal laptop but yes people think Apples are bad and windows are better to me they are almost the same just windows are more preferred gaming and macbook is for more of the business people. I'm not saying that macbook is not for gaming, it is and games run perfectly if no better then some computers I've been on. But idk I'm not tech savvy so just saying what I've experienced

thank you for your reply. I'm not really tech savvy either. Glad to know MacBook air can handle the game. 

Never really thought about lowering the settings, I just leave it as default on mine.

LOL I'm sorry bro but if you buy a MacBook not to mention because it "looks amazing" then you are a hipster. Apple is a garbage company with overpriced products but since they look like alien shiny tech everyone buys it. I can handle people needing a MacBook for school or already having one but if you are going to get one for the sake of it and ignoring the facts, I have something to say:

I was so damn excited to get a Mac, it looked so cool and I thought I would enjoy it until it died. You get so used to the bad UI and operating system. It's so slow and bad specs and the pricepoint, it throttles and limits FPS, it can't apply even the best specs properly on the operating system. As soon as I switched to Windows (and PC in general) after 3 years of using the Mac which costed $2300 for 8GB ram and a crappy GPU.

If you need something to use on the go and can't get a desktop just look at some of the higher quality laptop brands, which happen to be cheaper than the mid range MacBooks.
